newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK DEPO CURVE EASES, BONDS HOLD, ECU/DRS STABLE.
newsitem.headline: GREEK DEPO CURVE EASES, BONDS HOLD, ECU/DRS STABLE.

text.p: The Greek interbank depo curve eased, forex forwards were also easier in calm trading and bonds were holding awaiting the outcome of the central bank's depo tender today, dealers said.
Trading activity in the forex market picked up without affecting the highly visible ecu/drachma rate which was trapped in the 309.10/25 band, traders said.

"The short-end of the depo yield curve has eased about a tenth of a point and the long-end about five basis points," said a senior dealer at a foreign bank. "Forex forwards have followed suit on the downside."
The dealer said the market was awaiting to see whether the Bank of Greece would leave some money into the system today to help Thursday's auction of FRNs.
The central bank offered to drain an unspecified amount of 14-day funds at 11.90 percent today. A pact of about 150 billion drachmas is maturing today.
Greece will auction 150 billion drachmas of seven-year FRNs on June 26. The first coupon is set at 10.40 percent.

"FRN prices are stable but still low and it looks as if the finance ministry will not get the best deal out of tomorrow's auction," said a dealer at a foreign bank. "Funding remains expensive and the central bank's move to buy a small amount of FRNs on Wednesday will not help much."
The central bank bought about 1.0 billion drachmas of seven-year FRNs due 2004 on Wednesday.
"The bond market is quiet and prices are holding," said a bond dealer. "It will help if the central bank boosts liquidity today via its 14-day, fixed rate depo tender."
The gross redemption yield of the benchmark 10-year coupon bond due 2007 was at 9.14 percent, the five-year bond due 2002 was yielding 9.77 percent and the three-year bond due 2000 at 10.20 percent.
The mark was quoted at 157.76/86 from Tuesday's 157.715 fix, the dollar at 271.57/67 drachmas from 271.900 and the ecu at 309.12/22 from 309.140 drachmas.

"Ecu/drachma opened at 309.10/15 and hit 309.20/25 before receding to 309.10/15 on light selling from domestic players," said a forex dealer at a foreign bank. "There is more action on both sides of trade today."
The National Bank of Greece quoted the following early rates:
** Overnight at 11.70-12.20
** One week at 11.50-12.00
** Two weeks at 11.50-12.00
** Three weeks at 11.45-11.95
** One month at 11.40-11.90
** Two months at 11.40-11.90
** Three months at 11.30-11.80
** Six months at 10.90-11.40
** Nine months at 10.75-11.25
** Twelve months at 10.60-11.10
--Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
